div.p: From William Potter to Robert Rogers
E97/3566, unit 972, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have just received the enclosed letter from Messrs. Lamb Smith & Co.
The letter from Lamb Smith & Co., Valuers & Land & Estate Agents, is dated 19 February 1897. The amount they were waiting on was £10.10.0; see W. Potter to C. Topp, 27 March 1897.
On 23 February 1897, Turner minuted: 'Matter not yet dealt with by Cabinet'. There is a further annotation by Turner: 'Mr Topp [i.e. the Under Secretary] to ascertain what it will cost to put up some memto on grave &c — not to exceed say £100'. Other creditors are pressing us, and we have no money to pay them with. The Executors would be glad if you could ascertain for us when it will be convenient for the Hon. Sir George Turner to honour us with a brief interview, as we do not know what reply to give to Messrs. Lamb Smith and other until after we have a knowledge of what the Government intend to do in the matter.
